name: Reconverse
description: Reconverse aims to provide a coherent and composable suite of analytics tools for informing the response to disease outbreaks, health emergencies and humanitarian crises, using the R software environment.

sdgs.relevance: Recoverse is a package of open-source software analytics to help field experts, epidemiologists, researchers, and others make informed responses to disease outbreaks, health emergencies and humanitarian crises

NonPII.nonPIIAccessMechanism: any dataset imported into the R software, which supports a very wide list of open formats (csv, txt, json, xml, ...) and some proprietary ones (xls, xlsx, ...)

openStandards: xml https://github.com/reconverse/grates RECONverse follows best practices for open software development for R packages laid out by the R Epidemics Consortium
which were adapted from similar guidelines from rOpenSci (https://github.com/ropensci/software-review):

- Guidelines for software development (http://www.repidemicsconsortium.org/resources/guidelines/). Best practices for code development include: version control (GIT) hosted on public repositories (github)
extensive use of unit testing and coverage statistics
and the use of a clear lifecycle for software development.
- It also complies with the CRAN guidelines for writing R extensions (https://cran.r-project.org/doc/manuals/R-exts.html)
